meanings.definition: A photograph or film shot taken at very close range.
meanings.sent1: The photographer captured stunning closeups of flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The movie director used closeups to show the actor's emotions.
meanings.sent3: I tried taking closeups of my cat, but he kept moving around!
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a series of closeups, each detail crystal clear.
meanings.sent5: The closeups of the sunset made it look even more beautiful and vibrant.

meanings.definition: A detailed or close view or inspection.
meanings.sent1: During the science experiment, we needed closeups of the cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The detective conducted a closeup of the crime scene for evidence.
meanings.sent3: I did a closeup of my messy room and realized I needed to clean up.
meanings.sent4: His speech was like a closeup of his thoughts, revealing every detail.
meanings.sent5: The closeup of the painting showed intricate brushstrokes and colors.
